p: Overall, in silico methods have proven to be valuable resources in MBF research, to design and screen large libraries of potential antiviral and vaccine candidates as well as model host-pathogen interactions and study potential mechanisms of infection and transmission dynamics. In silico models can play a major role in research on the prevention of MBF infection through vector control and provide a better understanding of MBF transmission factors and patterns that lead to widespread MBF outbreaks. In addition, in silico modeling and high throughput screening of therapeutic or preventative drug candidates followed by in vitro validation has potential to speed up the process of MBF drug development.
